key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares consistently match direct rates, exceeding 97% alignment, though not-found fares rose closer to departure.
MSE-lower stands at around 60%, with a recent dip; fare parity increased by 3%, indicating stronger alignment.
GDS maintains roughly 98% parity, with minor availability gaps mostly under 2% but peaking on long-haul routes.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 97% of fares in the OTA channel match website pricing, indicating consistent parity.
OTA-lower results remain below 1% across all periods, showing negligible underpricing.
Not-found fares rose notably for close-in bookings (from 1.44% to 2.62%), suggesting increased unavailability.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Mostly under 3% outside long-haul, where it surpasses 7%.
Roughly 97â€“99% of itineraries mirror website rates, maintaining tight alignment.
Extremely rare at under 1% in all measured windows.
Generally around 0.75% overall but reaches 3.51% in long-haul markets.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Same fares dominate at 98%, with not-found offers holding below 1.3%.
Missing fares spike to 7.6%, and OTA-higher climbs to 3.51% last week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Over 97% parity; missing fares run near 1.9%, keeping disruptions low.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA N/A jumped to 2.62% from 1.44%; OTA-higher stays under 1%.
Coverage gaps remain below 1%, and nearly all fares match the airline site.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE-lower accounts for around 60% of fares but has fallen by nearly 2% week-over-week and about 6% month-over-month.
Parity increased by nearly 3% versus last week, signaling stronger alignment between direct and MSE pricing.
Fewer than 1% of listings show a premium on MSE, and N/A occurrences remain under 1% and declining.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Availability gaps stand at about 0.5% and continue to shrink from last month.
Matched fares total 38%, an increase of nearly 3% from last week, reflecting improved price parity.
Fewer than 1% of flights are higher on MSE, carrying roughly a 10% premium.
Around 60% of fares are cheaper on MSE by about 13%, though this share declined slightly.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 58% of short-haul fares are lower on MSE, down slightly, while 42% remain at parity.
Nearly 88% of long-haul itineraries are MSE-lower, offering around 20% savings.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 60% of US markets are cheaper on MSE by ~13%, with 38% in full parity.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 59% of itineraries are MSE-lower, averaging 16% savings, with parity up by 6% from last week.
63% remain cheaper on MSE by 8%, though MSE-higher jumped from 0.3% to 1.3% week-over-week.

gds_highlights.line_content: Nearly 98% of itineraries match website fares, reflecting stable channel alignment.
GDS not listing website fares stays under 2% overall, but reaches 7% on some long-haul routes.
Channel-lower fares remain tiny at 0.05% or less, indicating limited discount activity.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Remains near 1% overall, with higher instances noted on longer routes.
Over 97% parity persists week over week, signaling strong channel consistency.
Under 0.1% frequency, revealing negligible undercutting vs. the website.
Typically below 1%, though some long-haul fares reach around 4% higher than website.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Shows 99% fare matching, with minimal variations across reporting periods.
Greater discrepancies: up to 7% unavailability and ~4% channel-higher fares.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Maintains ~98% fare parity, with negligible channel-lower or channel-higher instances.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 1.7% of fares missing on GDS, with up to 1% channel-higher pricing in near-term bookings.
Over 99% parity for advance bookings; unavailability and price differences remain rare.
